curam.util.client.view

Class AbstractComponentRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.common.plugin.AbstractPlugIn
      • curam.util.client.view.AbstractComponentRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentRenderer<Component>, PlugIn

    public abstract class AbstractComponentRenderer
extends AbstractPlugIn
implements ComponentRenderer<Component>
    An abstract superclass for all non-domain-specific component renderer plug-ins. For domain-specific field component renderers, see the DomainRenderer interface.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the plug-in. This is usually the simple name used to identify the plug-in when loaded. Many different plug-in classes may share the same name if they implement the same type of behavior. For example, "converter" may be used as the name of a plug-in that performs data conversion operations, but there may be different "converter" classes implementing these operations.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface PlugIn
        Returns:
        The name of the plug-in. This must not be null.

      • acceptData

        public boolean acceptData(java.lang.Object data)
                   throws PlugInException
        Indicates if the plug-in will accept the given data for processing. It is up to the plug-in to decide what data it will accept. This method is called by the system before any processing methods of the specific types of supported plug-ins are called. Those processing methods will not be called if the data is not accepted, so this method allows the other methods on this plug-in to be written with the minimum of safety checks.

        This implementation accepts all data without any checks.

        Overrides the inherited implementation to reject all null data and all data that is not a Component object.

        Specified by:
        acceptData in interface PlugIn
        Overrides:
        acceptData in class AbstractPlugIn
        Parameters:
        data - The data to be processed; may be null.
        Returns:
        true if the plug-in will accept the data for processing, false otherwise. If false, an error will be reported by the system.
        Throws:
        PlugInException - If the reason for the rejection of the data is complex and a more specific exception message would make it easier to determine how to remedy the problem, an exception may be thrown instead of returning false.

      • renderLocal

        protected void renderLocal(AbstractComponentRenderer renderer,
                           java.lang.String purpose,
                           Component component,
                           org.w3c.dom.DocumentFragment fragment,
                           RendererContext context,
                           RendererContract contract)
                    throws ClientException,
                           DataAccessException,
                           PlugInException
        Invokes the render method on the provided component renderer after checking that the renderer will accept the given component by calling its acceptData method. If the renderer will not accept the data, an exception will be thrown, so the exception handling does not need to be implemented outside of this method. The local
        Parameters:
        renderer - The local renderer to be invoked.
        purpose - The local purpose for which the renderer is to be used. This is used to aid error reporting.
        component - The component to be rendered.
        fragment - A DOM document fragment to which to append the rendering.
        context - The context for this renderer. This can be used to resolve the paths to actual values.
        contract - The contract between this renderer and the renderer that wants to re-use it.
        Throws:
        ClientException - If the rendering fails.
        DataAccessException - If the renderer cannot access the necessary data.
        PlugInException - If the renderer cannot re-use another renderer or if the component is not accepted for rendering.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle(Component component,
                                 DataAccessor dataAccessor)
                          throws DataAccessException
        Gets the title that can be used to identify the component on the web page. The title will be the first non-null value taken, in order, from the title Text object, the title string, or the LABEL parameter of the field component.
        Parameters:
        component - The component whose title is to be rendered.
        dataAccessor - DataAccessor to be used to resolve the paths in the Text. This parameter is not mandatory. Specific implementations will throw a DataAccessException where its mandatory.
        Returns:
        The title, or null if none was available.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if there is a problem resolving the title Text.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription(Component component,
                                       DataAccessor dataAccessor)
                                throws DataAccessException
        Gets the description of the component which is displayed on the web page. The description will be the first non-null value taken, in order, from the description Text object or the description string.
        Parameters:
        component - The component whose title is to be rendered.
        dataAccessor - DataAccessor to be used to resolve the paths in the Text. This parameter is not mandatory. Specific implementations will throw a DataAccessException where its mandatory.
        Returns:
        The description, or null if none was available.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if there is a problem resolving the description Text.

      • setSrcOnImgElement

        public void setSrcOnImgElement(org.w3c.dom.Element img,
                               java.lang.String imgPath)
                        throws ClientException
        Sets the specified path to an image as the value of the src attribute on the specified HTML img element. If a static content server is configured then the specified path to an image will be set accordingly.
        Parameters:
        img - The specified image element
        imgPath - The specified path to the image. Paths that start with ../ are valid.
        Throws:
        ClientException - If the specified image cannot be set specified on the specified image element.

      • setSrcOnElement

        public static void setSrcOnElement(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                   java.lang.String resourcePath)
                            throws ClientException
        Sets the specified path to a resource as the value of the src attribute on the specified HTML element. If a static content server is configured then the specified path to a resource will be set accordingly.
        Parameters:
        element - The specified element
        resourcePath - The specified path to a resource. Paths that start with ../ are valid.
        Throws:
        ClientException - If the specified resource cannot be set specified as the specified src attribute on the specified element.

      • setHrefOnElement

        public static void setHrefOnElement(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                    java.lang.String resourcePath)
                             throws ClientException
        Sets the specified path to a resource as the value of the href attribute on the specified HTML element. If a static content server is configured then the specified path to a resource will be set accordingly.
        Parameters:
        element - The specified element
        resourcePath - The specified path to a resource. Paths that start with ../ are valid.
        Throws:
        ClientException - If the specified resource cannot be set specified as the specified href attribute on the specified element.

      • isCSRFTokenGenerationEnabled

        protected static boolean isCSRFTokenGenerationEnabled()
        Checks if enhanced CSRF protection has been enabled -- token based CSRF mitigation.
        Returns:
        a boolean which is set to true if CSRF token validation should be enabled.

      • includeCarbonComponent

        protected void includeCarbonComponent(RendererContext context,
                                      java.lang.String elementID,
                                      java.lang.String labels,
                                      java.lang.String messages,
                                      java.lang.String carbonFunction,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> addtionalConfig)
                               throws DataAccessException
        Includes the specific carbon component on the page by invoking the name of the JavaScript function and passing in the arguments to it.
        Parameters:
        context - The renderer context.
        elementID - The ID of the DOM node that this Carbon component will be attached to.
        labels - A string of labels that can be used for translation in Carbon component.
        messages - A string of messages that can be used for translation of error messages within the Carbon component.
        carbonFunction - The JavaScript Carbon function which will be used to instantiate the Carbon component.
        addtionalConfig - An optional map of key vale pairs to be passed as extra parameters to the Carbon JavaScript invocation.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If there is an issue accessing some date configuration.

      • setScriptAttributes

        protected void setScriptAttributes(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                   Component component)
        Sets the various script event handling attributes of the element from the parameters of the component.
        Parameters:
        element - The element on which to set the attributes.
        component - The specified component.
